headline.main: U.S. and Partners Quickly Set Sights on a Post-Taliban Kabul
headline.kicker: A NATION CHALLENGED: A NEW DAY

lead_paragraph: The United States and the countries most closely affected by developments in Afghanistan called today for ''broad-based, multiethnic, politically balanced, freely chosen Afghan administration'' to take charge once the Taliban is totally driven from Kabul. The goal, issued in a statement by a group known here as ''Six plus Two'' -- the United States and Russia plus China, Iran, Pakistan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan, became more urgent tonight with the news that the Taliban had withdrawn from Kabul. The group met with the special United Nations envoy, Lakhdar Brahimi, who returned last week after a tour of the region and whose mission the group formally endorsed.
abstract: United States and countries most closely affected by developments in Afghanistan call for 'broadbased, multiethnic, politically balanced, freely chosen Afghan administration' to take charge once Taliban is totally driven from Kabul; goal is issued in statement by so-called Six Plus Two group: US and Russia, plus China, Iran, Pakistan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan; group meets with special United Nations envoy, Lakhdar Brahimi, who has toured region and whose mission group formally endorses; Brahimi says he will seek to convene 'representative sample' of Afghan population and see about interim arrangements for Kabul; Secretary General Kofi Annan says political aspects must be brought in line with fast-moving military developments on the ground, and Secretary of State Colin Powell also stresses need for speed; photo (M)
snippet: The United States and the countries most closely affected by developments in Afghanistan called today for ''broad-based, multiethnic, politically balanced, freely chosen Afghan administration'' to take charge once the Taliban is totally driven fro...
